post_text: The Alabama Broadband Connectivity (ABC) Program will provide home internet access vouchers for families of students currently eligible for free and reduced-price school meals. Each eligible household will receive a voucher letter that will look like the ones attached. Letters will begin to reach mailboxes on Monday, August 24th. A prepaid voucher number will be included in the letter. The vouchers will cover the cost of equipment, installation, and high-speed internet service through Dec. 30, 2020. The voucher letter contains each household’s unique prepaid voucher number, a list of participating internet service providers in the area, and 4 steps to take in order to receive the free internet service.
text: The Alabama Broadband Connectivity (ABC) Program will provide home internet access vouchers for families of students currently eligible for free and reduced-price school meals. Each eligible household will receive a voucher letter that will look like the ones attached. Letters will begin to reach mailboxes on Monday, August 24th. A prepaid voucher number will be included in the letter. The vouchers will cover the cost of equipment, installation, and high-speed internet service through Dec. 30, 2020. The voucher letter contains each household’s unique prepaid voucher number, a list of participating internet service providers in the area, and 4 steps to take in order to receive the free internet service.

post_text:
Please take a moment and review the Limestone County Reopening Plan. You can view it at www.lcsk12.org midway down the page.

We are happy to announce that the board and Dr. Shearouse are extending virtual school enrollment as well as allowing students to return to the traditional classroom. We will publish the links for “New Virtual Enrollment” and “Return to the Traditional Setting” on Friday, July 31 on all local school and district websites and social media. The links will be open until August 3, 2020 at midnight.

If you have enrolled in the virtual school and would like to remain enrolled, you do not have to do anything. Your enrollment is secure.

We are excited about the possibilities this new year will bring. We look forward to working with all students in Limestone County Schools.

LCSK12.ORG

text:
Please take a moment and review the Limestone County Reopening Plan. You can view it at www.lcsk12.org midway down the page.

We are happy to announce that the board and Dr. Shearouse are extending virtual school enrollment as well as allowing students to return to the traditional classroom. We will publish the links for “New Virtual Enrollment” and “Return to the Traditional Setting” on Friday, July 31 on all local school and district websites and social media. The links will be open until August 3, 2020 at midnight.

If you have enrolled in the virtual school and would like to remain enrolled, you do not have to do anything. Your enrollment is secure.

We are excited about the possibilities this new year will bring. We look forward to working with all students in Limestone County Schools.

shared_text:
Limestone County Schools
July 21 at 4:49 PM ·

The Alabama State Department of Education has partnered with the University of Alabama to conduct a statewide school technology survey. The purpose of this survey is to build a statewide repository detailing Internet connectivity and Internet-enabled digital device availability to inform decision makers as we expand remote learning capabilities and enhance high-quality instruction to students around the state.

Whether a student is attending school in a traditional classroom setting, virtually, or a blended version of traditional and virtual, it is important that we hear from parents across the state as the survey responses will impact our efforts to respond to ongoing changes relating to remote and blended learning options throughout our state. Please take a few moments to share and complete this statewide school technology survey. The deadline for completing the survey is Friday, July 31, 2020.

http://ow.ly/6ujg50AEdw4

post_text:
This evening, Limestone County Schools made the difficult decision to postpone all summer programs that were scheduled to begin tomorrow, July 6, 2020. We have multiple staff members directly exposed and one confirmed positive for COVID 19. While we are delayed, our excitement and passion for the summer programs will not be diminished. Everyone will follow CDC guidelines and Limestone County procedures to do our best to ensure that programs will take place on July 20, 2020. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and will keep you updated as things progress.

If you know of anyone that had planned to participate, please share this information with them asap so that everyone will get the notification.
text:
This evening, Limestone County Schools made the difficult decision to postpone all summer programs that were scheduled to begin tomorrow, July 6, 2020. We have multiple staff members directly exposed and one confirmed positive for COVID 19. While we are delayed, our excitement and passion for the summer programs will not be diminished. Everyone will follow CDC guidelines and Limestone County procedures to do our best to ensure that programs will take place on July 20, 2020. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and will keep you updated as things progress.

If you know of anyone that had planned to participate, please share this information with them asap so that everyone will get the notification.

The LCS Robotics Summer Camp is for upper elementary and middle school students. The annual Limestone County Robotics Team Camp coordinated by Monica McConnell is a separate event and will return next year. Sorry for the confusion.

post_text: Dr. Brad Lewis shares important information on the district Summer Programs beginning Monday, July 6, 2020.
text: Dr. Brad Lewis shares important information on the district Summer Programs beginning Monday, July 6, 2020.

post_text: Has your child always wanted to learn how to play the guitar? Limestone County Schools Summer Music Camp has 4 slots open for beginner guitar lessons 9-11 am July 6, 9, 13, and 16 for students in grades 6-12. We will provide a new guitar for the student to use for the 4 sessions. They will be the only student to use the guitar during the camp. The camp located at the former Owens Elementary building (21465 AL Hwy 99 also called Buck Island Rd) is free to Limestone County School students. Breakfast and lunch will also be provided at no charge. Please contact Allison.Usery@lcsk12.org to register.

post_text:
HELP US GET THE WORD OUT BY SHARING THIS POST!
We are counting on you to shape the future of Limestone County in the 2020 Census. As of today, our county is at a 51% self-response rate. Your responses directly impact federal funding resources to Limestone County for:
🚧 new road and bridge construction
🏥 hospitals, healthcare, and mental health services
👩‍🚒 fire departments
🥗 school lunches
👩‍🏫 teachers, special education, and schools
🏡 housing assistance for seniors, and more
Please visit 2020census.gov to help shape our future.
shared_text:
2020CENSUS.GOV
2020 Census | United States Census Bureau

post_text:
Starting Monday, March 2, Athens Police Dept and Fire Station No. 1 will have seat belt covers available upon request for families who have a child or adult with a special need. During a vehicle emergency, if the parent, for example, is unconscious, the seat belt cover alerts police, fire and medical personnel the child has a special need and may not recognize danger or may not respond to help.

The covers are free upon request while supplies last. A grant from Rep. Crawford, Sen. Butler and Sen. Melson allowed for the purchase of 300.
text:
Starting Monday, March 2, Athens Police Dept and Fire Station No. 1 will have seat belt covers available upon request for families who have a child or adult with a special need. During a vehicle emergency, if the parent, for example, is unconscious, the seat belt cover alerts police, fire and medical personnel the child has a special need and may not recognize danger or may not respond to help.

The covers are free upon request while supplies last. A grant from Rep. Crawford, Sen. Butler and Sen. Melson allowed for the purchase of 300.

post_text: Friday is the day our "Bus" will be heading to Marshall County to deliver our gifts of LOVE to our fellow educators. Please make your donations if you haven't already. We want to shower them with our gifts, thoughts and prayers for strength and endurance. Brindlee Mountain Primary School
shared_text:
Limestone County Schools
February 7 at 3:52 PM ·

LOAD THE BUS FOR BRINDLEE MOUNTAIN

Limestone County Schools will be collecting supplies to donate to Brindlee Mountain teachers to help them put their classrooms back together.

Items needed include: dry erase markers, chart paper, cardstock, tape, staples, markers, clip boards, folders, velcro, magnetic letters, letter tiles, play dough, letter stamps, ink pads, plastic storage bins, index cards, headphones, laminating pouches, construction paper, permanent markers, and art supplies.

Gift cards to Amazon, Wal-Mart, Staples etc. would be great too.

You can drop off your donations at any Limestone County school campus or at the Central Office in Athens. The deadline for donations is Friday, February 21, 2020.

Let’s share our love for learning with the teachers and students at Brindlee Mountain Primary School

post_text: There will be delays in bus routes today as many are having to find alternate routes. There are too many to report individual bus numbers. Please be patient with us as we navigate this morning.

post_text: Due to flooding across the district, Limestone County Schools will operate on a two hour delay Thursday, February 6.
text: Due to flooding across the district, Limestone County Schools will operate on a two hour delay Thursday, February 6.

post_text: Due to threat of severe weather all Limestone County Schools will close today as follows: Elementary Schools at 12:40 pm and High Schools at 1:00 pm.
text: Due to threat of severe weather all Limestone County Schools will close today as follows: Elementary Schools at 12:40 pm and High Schools at 1:00 pm.

post_text: Limestone County Schools celebrate counselors for being actively engaged in helping students examine their abilities, strengths, interests and talents; for working in a partnership with parents as they encounter the challenges of raising children in today’s world; for focusing on positive ways to enhance students’ academic, postsecondary and social/emotional development; and working with teachers and other educators to provide an educational system where students can realize their potential and set healthy, realistic and optimistic aspirations for themselves. #nscw2020
